name: places/ChIJnbnjxQVZwokREE1DUPfrxgE
formattedAddress: 192 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 192 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002-1410, USA

originalText.text:
This is a review for Victoria HairArtistry who rents a chair at Le Noble.

I booked a New Client Full transformation on 1.21.2024 with Victoria which was mediocre and subpar at best.

The whole process was rushed. I was done in under an hour. On her website, the new Client full transformation is a 1.5hr time slot which includes wash, scalp detox, haircut, styling, and maintenance discussion.

I arrived on time and Victoria took me right away. There was no scalp detox treatment as the wash and condition was barely 4 mins long. The consultation was probably 5-10 mins. The haircut was about 20mins, and the blow-dry was another 10-15.

For a $300 service, I would’ve expected Victoria to at least offer me a cup of water but no, she didn’t offer any beverage. She did however try to sell me Saphira products which she didn’t even use on my hair to wash/condition. She only used like 3 drops of the oil on the ends.

The haircut itself is choppy, disconnected, heavy/blunt right on the top, and the bangs weren’t cut properly as there are a bunch of straggly pieces. The blow-dry was probably the worst I’ve ever had in my life, and I’ve been going to the salon to get my hair done since Victoria has probably been born. I guess she was disappointed I wanted a blow out instead of diffuse but why would I pay $300 + tax + tip to diffuse my hair? I guess the clients coming in on their parent’s dime don’t care but I do. The blow-dry lasted all of 5 mins as I stepped out it became a hot mess.

Won’t return to Victoria and regret even giving her a chance tbh. It was a poor experience all around and a crappy result for $372.

originalText.text:
I have been to so many salons in NYC and nobody could get my color right but Blake Vulgamott nailed it!  He is a 10/10 and I am obsessed with him and my hair color!  He is an expert on color theory and talked me through the whole process!
Highly recommend. Location is super easy to get to and the salon is so cute and the owner Tina is the sweetest!!

originalText.text: Tina and the team at LeNoble Studios are all amazing! Tina has been cutting my hair for years and I always leave so happy. She is super attentive to your hair needs and the space is beautiful and clean. 10/10 recommend!

text.text: Tina and the team at LeNoble Studios are all amazing! Tina has been cutting my hair for years and I always leave so happy. She is super attentive to your hair needs and the space is beautiful and clean. 10/10 recommend!

originalText.text: I wish I had a before and after picture the day I got my haircut. I was truly amazed by how much I had learned and how much better I looked. My hair was overgrown, dry, dead, and I never knew how to maintain my waves because my mom has pin-straight hair and my dad with the wavy hair trait is bald. The time I spent with Tina was invaluable because I walked away feeling more confident with my appearance and I am so thankful to have come across her studio.

text.text: I wish I had a before and after picture the day I got my haircut. I was truly amazed by how much I had learned and how much better I looked. My hair was overgrown, dry, dead, and I never knew how to maintain my waves because my mom has pin-straight hair and my dad with the wavy hair trait is bald. The time I spent with Tina was invaluable because I walked away feeling more confident with my appearance and I am so thankful to have come across her studio.

originalText.text: Tina has given me the best haircuts I have ever had. She also taught me how to style and blow out my hair like she does in the salon. The salon is gorgeous and so eclectic. I have even started bringing my kids to get their cuts with her as well. She is such an artist and a lovely person.
